intro: Moritzia lindenii, commonly known as the Lindens' moritzia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in humid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
